feed.title: NewsTracker: germanwings
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Germanwings crash families accuse airline of ignoring them
entry.summary: BERLIN (AP) - A group of parents whose children were killed in the Germanwings plane crash in March have written a scathing letter to Lufthansa's CEO, accusing him of ignoring their needs and feelings.

entry.title: Germanwings crash families accuse airline of ignoring them
entry.summary: The letter comes amid negotiations with Lufthansa, Germanwings' parent airline, over compensation.

entry.title: Crash victims' families reject Germanwings compensation offer
entry.summary: Lufthansa chief executive Carsten Spohr (second right) and board members observe a minute of silence for the victims of the Germanwings flight 4U9525 before the annual shareholders' meeting in Hamburg in April.

entry.title: Attorney for Germanwings victims says compensation too low
entry.summary: BERLIN (AP) - A German attorney representing some 30 families of victims of the March Germanwings plane crash says his clients are rejecting the airline's initial compensation offer as far too low.

entry.title: EU panel urges pilot screening after Germanwings crash
entry.summary: That would go beyond the traditional regulations and may have alerted colleagues sooner to the condition of the Germanwings pilot.

entry.title: EU urges pilot screening after Germanwings crash
entry.summary: All airline pilots should undergo psychological screening and allow details of medical visits to be shared in a proposed European database, according to recommendations delivered to the European Commission in the wake of the Germanwings disaster.

entry.title: EU task force seeks mental exams, drug tests for pilots
entry.summary: A European Union task force is recommending pre-employment psychological evaluations and random drug and alcohol tests for pilots to prevent a repeat of the Germanwings disaster.

entry.title: Europe to vet pilots for mental illness after Germanwings tragedy
Germanwings co-pilot Lubitz's estate is declared bankrupt
Germanwings offers emotional damage payments to crash victims' families
entry.summary:
BERLIN - Germanwings is offering 25,000 euros ($27,958) compensation payments to close relatives of those killed in the March 24 plane crash for their pain and suffering, it said on Tuesday.

Germanwings, a unit of Lufthansa, said on Tuesday it wished to treat everyone fairly, although one lawyer said the offer was not sufficient.

entry.title: Lawyer: Lufthansa makes Germanwings compensation offer
